problems.title: Repeated String Match (String Algorithm)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Given two strings a and b, return the minimum number of times you should repeat string a so that string b is a substring of it. If it is impossible for b to be a substring of a after repeating it, return -1.

Notice: string "abc" repeated 0 times is "", repeated 1 time is "abc" and repeated 2 times is "abcabc".
problems.examples:
Sample Input
abcd cdabcdab

Sample Output
3

Explanation: We return 3 because by repeating a three times "abcdabcdabcd", b is a substring of it.

Sample Input
a aa

Sample Output
2

Explanation: We need to repeat "a" twice to get "aa".
problems.constraints:
1 <= a.length, b.length <= 10^4
a and b consist of lowercase English letters.
hintsList: Calculate the minimum number of repetitions needed based on string lengths.
Check if b is a substring of the repeated string.
